alert.note: Alert for Central Blue Mountains; Southern Blue and Strawberry Mountains (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued July 08 at 3:40AM PDT until July 08 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...ISOLATED TO SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS SATURDAY COULD LEAD TO NEW FIRE STARTS... .A surge of Pacific moisture across the mountains of eastern Oregon will trigger isolated to scattered thunderstorms Saturday afternoon and evening. While some rain will accompany the storms, dry fuels and lightning strikes outside the rain cores will favor new fire starts. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THIS MORNING TO 11 PM PDT THIS EVENING FOR ABUNDANT LIGHTNING FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES OR642 AND OR644... * AFFECTED AREA...Fire Weather Zones 642 Southern Blue and Strawberry Mountains and 644 Central Blue Mountains. * IMPACTS...Lightning strikes may create new fire starts. * THUNDERSTORMS...Scattered Storms will form by early afternoon and continue through the mid to late evening Saturday. * OUTFLOW WINDS...Gusty and erratic winds up to 40 mph will be possible near and within storms.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: Central Blue Mountains; Southern Blue and Strawberry Mountains
